Reviews.Title: “poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: jammy7162
Reviews.Content: spent one night in this hotel & to be honest i won't be back. i stayed with 2 friends and was allocated the top floor. the room was tiny with 3 single beds virtually stuck together and not enough room to swing a cat. we were told breakfast was 7-9 so we were down for 8 and there were no tables, we tried again four times and eventualy at the 5th time of trying we got a table at 8.55 and it was not worth the wait as it was disgusting, so we left hungry !!! next time i travel to london i will be staying in the camden area

Reviews.Title: “Fair value for money - no-thrills hotel”
Reviews.Author: xach
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for - limited service and tiny rooms, but you do have a correct breakfast (again for the price) and free-wifi - all hotels in that neighbourhood and that price range don't necessarily have this. Rooms and linen are clean.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location at a great price for London, but small things let it down”
Reviews.Author: senti2comun
Reviews.Content: This is a no-frills hotel near to Kings Cross and Bloomsbury, which for me is extra convenient for short stopovers in London. However, Bloomsbury is full of tiny, private, cheap hotels in a similar price range to the Montana Excel, and having stayed in a few of them, there are some things which let the Montana down. Positives are free wifi and a very reasonable price. Some travellers complain about the size of the rooms. They are small (I mean, swing-a-cat small) but sorry, people, this is London. Big rooms come at a price, so then pay a bit more (twice as much, in fact) and go to the Premier Inn in Kings X. This is the third small hotel I have used in Bloomsbury / Kings X in the same price range, and I can say that the room sizes are pretty well all the same. Ground floor street rooms can be noisy - you have been warned...! Where the Montana does fall down compared to its peers are things like plastic coffee cups instead of china, fuzzy TV with only analogue channels (digital TV is free in the UK, so I really don't understand this). And no guest should have to stand queueing on the stairs for breakfast! If there are not enough seats then either expand breakfast hours so some people can eat later, or add a couple of tables (which could be tricky). Oh, and hire an extra pair of hands and stop overworking the great staff down there. It is unacceptable. Talking of breakfast, its a cooked breakfast, which is what some people want, but vegetarians or non-pork eaters may find the alternatives limited. There is no cereal, only toast. Its a good option for a quick, cheap overnight but if I was staying in London for longer I would probably choose one of the other Bloomsbury options .. or, like I said, pay a bit more!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and near Kings Cross station”
Reviews.Author: pookle1
Reviews.Content: Solo traveler, so I was interested in finding a place to sleep just for one night near the train station that was safe, clean and provided breakfast and free wifi. This is a no frills place- if you arrive early, you place your luggage in a small locked closet with everyone else's. Shared toilet, but I had a shower in my room. Breakfast was buffet style and had many options of meats, toast, beans, etc. I would stay here again. As for the complaints that the rooms were small...this is a B&B in Europe, they are all smaller than Americans are used to! Part of the charm.

Reviews.Title: “Triple room. Triple fun.”
Reviews.Author: Andrew Y
Reviews.Content: 3 beds stuffed into a room the size of a cupboard. Polystyrene cups and a handful of teabags. No floor space. Tiny shower squeezed into the corner. No toilet in the room (we had to share with the other 7 rooms on the floor). Three of us sharing that room each had to perform some sort of elaborate Hokey Cokey whenever anyone attempted a tricky maneouvre (such as tying a shoelace, changing a shirt, breathing). Needless to say, we skipped breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “total disappointment”
Reviews.Author: gigitoro61
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because it's really close to King's Cross station. I spent more than I had spent in much better hotels. The room was quite dirty, the tea kettke hadn't been emptied, there was rubbish on the floor, the emergency instructions along with the hotel info were hidden in a cupboard and the room was really tiny.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel, good Eurostar location.”
Reviews.Author: Phillyconnor
Reviews.Content: Very basic hotel, hardly slept with the noise from next room. Shared toilet on corridor, polystyrene cups n handful of typhoo tea bags on the side, tv from the 70's with most buttons missing. Location is good ideal for kings cross station and looks ok from outside. Set in a nice square of London town house style buildings. Don't think I'd stay here again unless it was a really good deal, did the job but was a pretty basic and scary nights sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: SwimmingSeas
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for two nights and the location was perfect, as we were travelling to and from King's Cross/St. Pancras. Also very central for sightseeing, shopping, theaters etc. However, that was the only good thing about this place! We arrived before noon and were offered the key to the storage room to put our luggage in. This (in the shape of a large cupboard) was dirty and full of litter thrown on the floor and on the shelves. Not a good sign. The carpeted staircase smelled musty. The room was fairly clean, even though small and cheaply furnished. It had a tiny shower in the corner of the room, so small that one basically could stand up in it, but not move their limbs to shower properly. The shower cabin had no lighting and was separated from the room by a curtain, making it impossible to avoid spluttering water on the carpet. Breakfast was even worse. The breakfast room was overcrowded at all times and the food the cheapest, worst quality products one could buy. I've never had such bad food, not even in 12 euro/bed student hostels! I know hotels are ludicrously expensive in Central London, but I still hope there's better value to be had for this money!

Reviews.Title: “Very close to Kings Cross/St Pancras”
Reviews.Author: Lydsmate
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel because we were catching the Eurostar the next day. The hotel was perfect for what we wanted it for. It was cheap as well. We arrived late in the evening and there was a 24 hour reception so checking in was ok. We left early the next morning, too early to get breakfast at the hotel. (There is a nearby macdonalds though which was open!) The room was small but clean. There was a shower in the room (literally), with just a curtain to shield you. There was no toilet in the room, however there was one just along the corridor. There was a kettle with tea and coffee provided. Our room was opposite a park, so it was very quiet and peaceful. If I was catching the eurostar again, and needed somewhere to stay in London, I would stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for eurostar stop over.”
Reviews.Author: wilko-pink
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the hotel for one night between our train and eurostar journey. Very quick and easy toget to from Kings Cross tube station and 24hr check in for our late arrival. room small and clean with just a shower. Shower in room with just a curtain so not so great if you are travelling with someone you are not that familiar with! toilet about two doors down which was fine. Tea, coffee and tv in room. Did not make breakfast asleft too early. Perfect hotel if you just need a couple of hours sleep at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Small, different but did the job”
Reviews.Author: Jezza_Bella123
Reviews.Content: My partner booked us into this hotel when we stayed in 2010...the receptionists were fairly friendly...it was a lot smaller than i had imagined but it was cosy. The rooms only had a shower in the corner. The toilet was in the corridoor outside for eveyone to share, which id never experienced before so that was different. Been 8 month pregnant the toilet was visited a lot during the night so a lot of people must have seen me in my wacky pjs ....there appeared to be a lot of students staying so it was a bit noisy at times. The rooms were fairly small too. The location of the hotel was near euston and kings cross station and a ten min walk from oxford street. So if you are planning to go for a shopping hol it is ideal. The breakfast was pleasent. nice variety of cereal and a nice little buffet of full breakfast items.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel ever stayed in!!!”
Reviews.Author: Laura G
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the worst hotel we have ever stayed in!!!We got the basement room, no natural light, very hot and stuffy, bathroom was good size but massive window which was onlooked by other rooms in hotel. We were woken up many a time throughout the night by people running up an down stairs and also woken very early as room was next to breakfast room. Breakfast was basic which is fine but was not enough for all guests. It is over priced for what it is. Staff on front desk were lovely and helpful, but we would NEVER stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Basic bed and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Varty_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an excellent location. It is on a quiet street with a park across the street where my kids played. It is a block from the Kings Cross tube station and just across the street from that is the St Pancras station where we caught the train to Calais. The neighbourhood is full of little restaurants and other convenient shops. The hotel has a nice breakfast. The room was tiny but we had a window looking out on the street. The price was reasonable for London. This hotel is not to be mistaken for another hotel in London called the Montana, a 5 star hotel. Somehow I got to that hotel's website when I was looking up information just before leaving for London. When I got to the Montana Excel I asked, "Where is the swimming pool?"

Reviews.Title: “ok for a night”
Reviews.Author: Kate012
Reviews.Content: An ok hotel for one night and low price for central London. Good bits * 24 check in - good for us as we arrived late and left at 6am for Eurostar (too early for breakfast) * Location - ideal for catching the Eurostar * Clean room, toilet (shared) and shower * Not too noisy - not on the main road though you are in central London so it's never completely quiet * First floor room - large window Not so great * The big let down was the matress which was really poor quality and needed replacing. There were several uncomfortable springs sticking up. * Towels / bedding were very tired and although clean were ripped in some places * Shower in room was not lit - a small cubicle in the corner of the room with no separate lighting so when the shower curtain is drawn you shower in semi darkness. As long as you don't go expecting much you won't be dissappointed, at the end of the day you get what you pay for and this hotel was ~30% cheaper than the others I looked at in the area. If you are planning on spending very little time at the hotel it certainly does the job as a place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Okay (for London)”
Reviews.Author: ddrCanada
Reviews.Content: Booked a room for four people for three nights and paid 345 British Pounds, little more pricey than we wanted to pay for pretty good for London. Room was alright, it was in the basement so therefore it felt damp and we were right across from the breakfast room which was alright for going for breakfast but not good because the walls are not sound proof so we were woken up early from people going to eat. Breakfast was only from 0700 until 0900, which we thought was too short but oh well. There was only a tub in the bathroom, no shower. Not a problem for us but maybe others. The hotel is really close to King's Cross/St. Pancras station which is very handy and also only a 40 minute walk from Baker Street if you take a bus from the airport to city centre. I would stay here again because London is hard to find decent/affordable hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive and noisy”
Reviews.Author: zilojian
Reviews.Content: The location is very near to King's Cross but definitely not worth the money. Our double room was on the ground floor and we could hear people going up and down the stairs. The furniture in the room are old and the room urgently needs modernisation. Moreover, the windows were small and had bars across them. The room feels like a prison.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic value for money”
Reviews.Author: CatherineElizabeth80
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the night before our Eurostar to Brussels - just what we needed. Cheap, large room, shower, tea and coffee, breakfast (although not great, but good toast!). I'd recommend, obviously if you are expecting luxery you would spend more!

Reviews.Title: “Bad hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: DeborahNZ_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great spot for people using Eurostar but it is not a 3 star hotel. It is a rabbit warren of small rooms and ours had truly disgusting carpet. The breakfast is also well below standard.

Reviews.Title: “Only if you're desperate”
Reviews.Author: SydneyChrisS
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights because we couldn't get into the place we wanted to stay and the location seemed handy. It was 2 nights too long. The room we were in looked nothing like the room in the hotel's pictures. It was REALLY tiny - not enough room for 2 people and luggage. The furnishings were in very poor condition and ugly. We booked a room with a shower and that's exactly what we got - a room with a fibreglass shower capsule in the corner of the room (it wasn't even a seperate bathroom). The shower capsule was so narrow you could barely move around in it and had a bizarre sign inside it saying "do not use with hot water"! The water poured out of the showerhead like a tap. At breakfast I saw the kitchen staff handling the food with their bare hands. This place was not clean at all. On the plus side, it was very close to King's Cross Station and the front desk staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Although this place was supposed to be cheap for London, I thought it was far too expensive for what you get. Only stay here if you have no other choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic; goood for one or two nights”
Reviews.Author: SashaSeattle
Reviews.Content: This is the only hotel that I stayed at in London and I picked it because it was very close to Kings Crossing/ St. Pancras and it was more affordable ( 45 pounds for the night). In comparison to the hotels I also stayed at during this trip ( in Italy and France); this hotel was really just OK. You had to walk thorough the shower stall to the bathroom and I was in a basement room with one window that opened to the ground level into an alley. Not a window I would have left open over night but it was very cool while I was there. The breakfast was good; eggs, beans, tomatoes, toast and so forth. Overall nothing to be impressed with; but if you need an affordable place for a night or two in a good location it works!

Reviews.Title: “very basic but clean,great location for touring london”
Reviews.Author: milothewestie
Reviews.Content: we stayed in room 15 up three flights of stairs,room was very small with double bed wardrobe small 14 inch television on table with tea and coffee in room,shower which you walked through for the toilet first time ive seen this,we payed 75.00 a little pricey but thats what you have to pay in central london overall not bad,train station kings cross and st pancras at bottom of street along with the underground

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: c0vw0lves
Reviews.Content: My wife and I wanted somewhere cheap for 1 night visit to see a show but we went too cheap with this place what a sh**********e.We had en suite but there was not enough room to use the loo and we r only average build so had to use the one on the landing anyway. The communal toilet was next to our room and people were backwards and forwards all night.Hence little or no sleep and the breakfast was worse cooked breakfast I have ever had it was really cold.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied for what I paid”
Reviews.Author: Seebob69
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Montana Excel for 7 nights in June 2011. Booking before I left home,I booked a single room with shower for 40 pounds per night. Now this is very cheap for a hotel in central London,being within spitting distance of Kings Cross station. I didn't expect much and I reckon I got what I paid for. The room was small, as I expected. The shower was tiny and was probably the most irritating part of my stay. I'm an average sized male but I could barely fit into the shower recess. The room was clean, I was on the 3rd floor, so got plenty of exercise climbing the stairs as there is no lift. My room was quiet, I had no disruptions from noisy guests during my 7 day stay. Full breakfast was provided daily, which was filling and tasty. Sure, reception staff were inattentive, but I rarely needed their assistance. Overall,my stay was pleasant, nothing flash,but I got what I paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic but good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Kongstaulus
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ok for the money. We only payed Â£ 40 a night for a twin room. The hotel was clean and the room was cleaned between nights. The toilets where clean too, but the showers had mold growing on the tiles and ceiling. Breakfast consisted of very basic cerial, good fried eggs and bacon, boiled tin tomatos, baked beans, sausages and white toast. Breakfast was adaquate, the bacon, poached egg and sausage were tasty, the rest not so good. Our room was quiet and comftable and the female emplyees were friendly. Luggage good be left in the luggage room. Free wifi was available but stopped working occasionly for about ten minutes each time.

Reviews.Title: “very central to kings cross station”
Reviews.Author: patrickjames40
Reviews.Content: if like us you are touring around london and are not fussy this hotel would do.They do a good breakfast .dining area is small can get a bit crammed .there is no lift in this hotel quite alot of stairs. and kings cross station is only 2mins walk at the end of the street

Reviews.Title: “Great location for taking Eurostar early next morning”
Reviews.Author: agnes1616
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I (in our 20's) stayed here for one night in late April. We arrived at about 6am and walked from King's Cross to the hotel - it is about 150 meters from the station. We were able to store our luggage in a room and use their wc to freshen up before heading out for the day. There are several bus stops in that area that will take you to the heart of London within 10 mins. We had a double room with private shower and wc for $80 CAD or 50 GBP. It was a small room but clean. The stairs at the hotel are pretty steep and they don't have elevators and you have to carry your own luggage. This wasn't a problem for us, but may be for some. I don't believe there was AC, but keeping a window opened was all we needed. There is a park across the street so you do hear some street noise. We were so jet lagged that we didn't even hear anything. The breakfast was very good with a variety of breads, eggs, sausage, cereal to choose from. I found the female receptionist to be very pleasant and extremely friendly. The next morning we walked to St Pancras to take the eurostar to Paris. I would recommend this hotel to those looking for a short stay at a budget hotel that is close to public transport.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel for good budget holiday”
Reviews.Author: MGC83
Reviews.Content: We arrived at around 1 p.m and reception told us rooms weren`t ready yet so we were provided with a luggage room. Well and good. We were travelling with another couple. One couple was given a room next to recption and ours was on the second floor. Mission impossible was to take up all our luggage on the second floor through a narrow staircase without the aid of a lift. The other couple staying in the room next to reception were told that the day after they were going to be given another room in the first floor cos it tends to be quite noisy and no window was available in the room. The room had all the basic amenties: a bed, a shower and a tv. However getting some sleep both during the afternoon and night was difficult. The walls were so thin you can hear what the other residents were doing!!!!! Our room was located next to the shared bathroom so during the night we were constantly woken up with door banging, toilet flushing!!! Breakfast was typical English breakfast. It was ok. Hotel location was perfect cos it was close to Kings Cross station and various restaurants. The best things about this hotel were the location, the friendly receptionists, and value for money. What we liked least are the ordeal of no lift and the thin walls.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, ridiculously hot, and rude staff - got about 2 hours' sleep in total”
Reviews.Author: SheepPurple
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner booked one night in this hotel as we had stayed there before, and it was in a good location for my hospital appointment early the next morning. All I wanted out of the booking was a bit of sleep really. We really liked it the first time we stayed there, but this time it was a total disaster. We were given a ground floor room right next to the reception area, and apparently underneath the stairs to the upper floors. The walls must be made of paper because we could hear the receptionist talking like she was in the room. She and another member of staff were talking, or rather shouting, until about 1 or 2am. Everytime someone walked past, or up the stairs, there was a loud creaking noise. I normally sleep quite deeply, but this woke me up every single time. The room itself had no window, so there was no natural daylight. The real problem however was that it got boiling hot during the night, which made sleeping even more difficult, if that was possible. The only positive thing was that we got an ensuite room when we didn't book it, however the room itself was also pretty dirty, with dust and hairs all over the drawers and wardrobe. I think I did get some sleep at some point, but probably not for more than 1, maybe 2 hours. The next morning, the "check out" consisted of the guy at the reception ripping the keys out of our hands while making some sort of grunting noise. He probably hadn't quite evolved yet to the next stage of human communication. Needless to say, we definitely will never be staying there again. I will go out of my way in the future to avoid this hotel and others of the same chain, as that kind of service is completely unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Typical London hotle in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: vicnzsa
Reviews.Content: This small and to a degree rambling hotel is cheap enough, clean enough, quiet enough and a good enough place to stay. Particularly if you are travelling to or from Paris on the Eurostar. Basically a big B+B. Do not expect anymore than a 3 star hotel and you will not be dissapointed. Only about 5 mins or so walk to the station and a few pubs around with good meals. We paid 60 pounds a night B&B for 2 in June 10.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Love0206
Reviews.Content: We do recommended this B&B for budget trip. Good location! Only few mins walk from King's Cross Station. The room was small but clean, with TV & electrical boiler. Very good breakfast with full set traditional English breakfast. The reception was opened for 24-hrs with free left luggage facility. But the staff were unfriendly.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap not so cheerful”
Reviews.Author: nutter90
Reviews.Content: For early eurostar the hotel location can't be beaten. It was certainly basic, as expected for the price. What we didn't expect were grubby carpets and the threadbare stairs down to breakfast room looked positively dangerous.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with some little problems”
Reviews.Author: Justa_guy_on_holiday
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed in a twin room for a friday night with a friend! Â£50 was a bargin for a weekend and the location, the room was small but i wasnt expection a Hitlon style suite for the price! Just a clean and cheap place to fall down after a night out in the town which it served its purpose! Now the little problem, I wasnt really happy with the night porter, I can understand security check when arriving back at the hotel at 2pm but there is nicer ways to do it! First..... of all I booked a twin room so why would you question when 2 people come to reception for the key! Second....I booked the room and dealt with all the paperwork as I speak better English, where as my friend speaks little English so a night porter asking him question like (where did you do tonight?, what name is the room booked under?)and not letting me translate isnt going to help! It was just a shame after having a great day and night to have to deal with rude staff member! Which puts a bad feeling into body and mind for the visit! Third and final....... A little maintance issue that we had a leak into our room for above which was solve quick it was just a shame the leak was in the wardrobe which caused us the have to wear a damp coat out the next morning! PS one plus i forgot to mention was the female receptionist that checked us in and out! She was amazing!! I just hope managment know it! Made us laugh at check in, dealt with the leak problem in the morning very quickly and was very apoligetic at ckeck out! Well Done!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful.”
Reviews.Author: chris171063
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly placed for access to the city. It is within a couple of minutes walk of kings cross and st pancras stations. The breakfast is good with a choice of cereals, toast, sausage, egg,bacon, beans and tomatoes, juice,tea and coffee. The rooms are small but clean and practical. We had en-suite facilities which again were small but very usable. We stayed here for easy access to the eurostar morning train and it was ideal for the money paid. I would recommend it for a one or two night stay. If you want luxury you need to pay more, but for a bed and breakfast it is good. Only problem was other guests being noisy when going to rooms and using bathroom late / early but this is not the hotel but thoughtless people. We would use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for a night”
Reviews.Author: RachaelBee
Reviews.Content: As the title states, the hotel was ok for a night but I wouldn't want to stay any longer. The location is good, it's near Kings Cross Station so consequently it was very easy to find and the transport links were convenient, we did walk to some of the major sights but it is a long way, we only chose it as we had to go somewhere in the opposite direction to the sights so it was central for our needs but not everyones. The hotel as a whole looked a bit shabby and the room was small, but we didn't expect luxury when the room had only cost Â£70. It really could do with a lick of paint and some new carpets though. The bed was comfortable and we would have had a good nights sleep if we hadn't been woken up in the middle of the night, firstly due to banging pipes and secondly by bed springs in the room above. The walls are very thin so if you're not an early riser you do get woken up by other guests. The staff were friendly, they are also happy to store your luggage for you until you check in and after you check out which was a definite plus. However when we went to check out the woman on reception was smoking which is not only illegal it's also very unpleasant. The breakfast (which is included in the rate) was delicious, however as other reviewers have mentioned you'll be lucky if you get a seat. We did manage but there were lots of people standing around waiting for somewhere to become free or taking their food up to their room. All in all I wouldn't recommend the hotel for longer than a night, it's not too bad if you're on a budget but I'm willing to bet you can get more for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect pound saver hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sarahandandrew
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently for 1 night and will definately use this little gem again. Very friendly reception staff with someone on hand 24hrs a day. Tidy looking from the outside on a lovely quiet little square just 2 minutes walk from Kings Cross station or 6 minutes walk to Euston station. If you prefer to walk around London this hotel is in a great location, you can be in Covent Garden in 10 - 15 minutes. We stayed in a ground floor room with easy access, the stairs to upper floors did look a little steep and narrow though. The room itself was a decent size with 2 single beds, waredrobe, TV, en suite toilet and shower, bedside cabinet with tea and coffee making facilities. Very clean and tidy, fresh sheets and extremely warm with the central heating! Don't think i've ever stayed anywhere so warm in my life, but that's a plus as there's nothing worse than a cold room. We didn't notice any noise as it's tucked away on a quiet square which was excellent. We didn't stay for breakfast so can't comment on that but it did smell great and was included in the price. There was free WiFi throughout the hotel which is a definate plus. This hotel is definately on a par, or in some cases considerably better than the chain budget hotels around London but at a fraction of the cost. Do your wallet a favour and stay here! : )

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in nice part of town”
Reviews.Author: tatranka
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is about five minute walk from St Pancras train station and underground station. Idealy located, if you arrive on London Luton airport. The hotel itself is small and offer free WiFi and terrific full English breakfast. You will love it! We stayed in room 101, and this room was equiped only with shower and smal basin. The toilet was in the coridor. The British museum is about 15-20minutes walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, excellent price, not a luxury spa”
Reviews.Author: dhphllps
Reviews.Content: The Montana is a small hotel in an old, somewhat rundown building just one and a half blocks from King's Cross and St. Pancras stations. Despite the closeness of the stations, it's in a quiet neighborhood, right across the street from a small park. I had a single room with a sink and shower, with a shared toilet across the hall. The room was up two flights of steep, creaky stairs covered in shabby, patched carpet, was barely bigger than the army cot-sized bed, and the shower so small it was difficult to close the door once inside. Having said all that, though, I would add that for anyone who views a hotel as a place to sleep and nothing more, this place is excellent. The staff were uniformly friendly and helpful, the (included) breakfast was good - although the breakfast room has inadequate seating - and as mentioned above, the location is excellent. Overall, as long as one is not expecting the Savoy, the Montana is a great value and a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poor accommodation”
Reviews.Author: surewhynot_10
Reviews.Content: Usually not one to complain, especially when facilities are cheap but this is much worse than other places in same budget category in same area that felt I have to. Absolutely tiny room just bigger than a single bed, up narrow stairs and 2 flights. Agree with others about noise from nearby rooms, luckily neighbours were considerate. Found it to be clean in general at least, it did have a TV, kettle and a sink. Made coffee in my room, the UHT milk curdled and had to abandon it. Room was described as ensuite - had to walk through shower in corner of the room to get to toilet behind it!! Never seen this before!! Just about enough room to change clothes between end of bed and door. No room to sit in breakfast room - choice of fry or fry, greasy ++ Took some bacon and dry toast back up to my room - you had to be seated to get tea or coffee. All in all i'd spend an extra Â£20 next time and get a much better room - as I have done before - they are available if you look especially if early. I'm done with this kind of budget accommodation, would probably have been better in a hostel!!

Reviews.Title: “Handy for the Eurostar!”
Reviews.Author: globetrotterYork
Reviews.Content: The location for this hotel is great. It is only a few minutes walk from St Pancreas International station, where we traveled to Disneyland Paris by Eurostar. The hotel is basic but clean. Staff were friendly. The room was quite small but we expected this with the style of building. The hotel has ensuite rooms and some which are not. We traveled with some friends who had one that was not, and the WC was just next door and so this was no bother to them. The price for the hotel was cheap for London, with the understanding that the location was superb. Breakfast was ok. It was a hot buffet style, not the best of crusine but Ive had worse at a Hilton! In a nutshell the hotel was OK. Basic, cheap,and clean. Ideal for a short stay or if you need somewhere VERY CLOSE to Kings cross or St Pancreas. Especially if you have a heavy case or two. If you want a more up market hotel you may not get the same sort of location as this one, and it will no doubt be more expensive. The road which this hotel is located has many other hotels in the same price range, so just read the reviews and choose accordingly. Be rest assured this hotel is OK for a no frills short stay. We live in York, which is on the East Coast Main line the train comes into Kings Cross,so this hotel is an idea choice if you have a lot of lugage and a child in a push chair to avoid paying for a taxi transfer or daring the tube to get to an alternative hotel. I would rate this hotel as 2*. Hope this helps you decide.

Reviews.Title: “good value and service”
Reviews.Author: PACALICIU
Reviews.Content: My dear if I would be taken according to some I just still have doubts, yet I tell you what happened, go to the hotel not two but even three people, the guy at the reception desk looked at my son 5 years three months and 108 cm. and ask "you want extra bed" and that they do not answer me OK then pay for food and child bed (at another hotel I paid 30 pounds, and as I think I stayed eight days is a good amount to spend on something else) clean room, quiet with a park view at breakfast for child I received a warm chocolate goodness, my son who does not drink at home or punished here more demanding, type English breakfast, and fresh enough for the family was the best price-quality-comfort-pleasure, and not the first time I travel to London, and the other three continents, with esteem and respect gladly recommend MONTANA EXCEL AscultaÅ£i CitiÅ£i fonetic DicÅ£ionar - AfiÅŸaÅ£i dicÅ£ionarul detaliatsubstantiv0.love0.sake0.pet0.honeyadjectiv0.dear0.beloved0.cherished0.precious0.favorite0.darling0.shine

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, Good Location, Lackluster Rooms and Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: WinterMN
Reviews.Content: This really is the epitome of a budget hotel, and you get what you pay for. Location is great: close to Kings Cross Station and many tube lines. Plenty of decent food within walking distance. They did a good job of keeping the shared bathrooms clean, though one of the toilets didn't flush while we were there. Rooms were very basic. We had two twin beds on the basement floor... No bed bugs, so yay for that! The Internet in the basement only worked about half the time. It was better upstairs. Oh, the breakfast was horrendous. The coffee tasted like it was flavored with cigarette butts and incense. After the first day, we didn't bother with it. Would recommend this hotel, but only if you are looking for a very basic, inexpensive place to stay in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - poor breakfast”
Reviews.Author: CarlaInEurope
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a very good area, just a few meters away from King's Cross Station, which connects you to most bus, train and tube stations in London. Bathrooms are usually clean, with toilet paper and soap. There are two bathrooms per floor. Beds are very comfortable and sheets are clean. I would say it's a little bit expensive for the services offered, but I guess location is what they charge you for. As regards breakfast, coffee is undrinkable... toasts are good. You can find butter and jelly on the table. I would suggest including some fruits and yoghurt. Internet is a plus, very good signal in ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “Stinks of urine and unwashed dogs.”
Reviews.Author: narbz1
Reviews.Content: The location is great. The staff are, well... fine. The room is... cosy, but the bed was comfortable. The window was broken. The shower is in the dark. The entire staircase and corridors reek of weeks-old urine and of dogs with untreated fungal infections. That's about it. Don't stay here unless you've brought nose pegs.

Reviews.Title: “customer service was rubbish”
Reviews.Author: sue1jones
Reviews.Content: the room was ok. bathroom not up to much. it was at breakfast we found the service was poor. we had to wait for a table. They left teapot from last people on the table we asked for fresh tea was given one tea one coffee. when i asked them to change it i was given a dirty look. manners cost nothing. if these people not happy with there job they should get another.I think they all need customer training.i would not stay there again or reckomend it to any friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: matrix1000
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for one nite to catch the eurostar next morning. U cant beat this hotel for location. Stayed in the Basic twin room with shared facililites. The toilet and bathroom was located near my room and it was shared with 3 other rooms, so not too bad never had to wait for the shower or toilet. Check was easy and the hotel was very clean including my room and the toilet and bath. The room was a good size with a sink and a bit bay window. Friendly staff. I got up in the morning and opened the window only to see someone's derriere as they were about to use the toilet. So a word of caution if u gonna use the shared toilet make sure you close the curtain.lol. There was a TV and tea and coffee facilities and storage. The twin beds had clean sheets, the room although clean the carpet was worn and the furniture seen better days. But it was a basic room I booked. One of the twin beds, the mattress was well worn, but the other was like new. The walls were a bit thin, I could hear the next door guest as they chatted the nite away, but they went to bed at midnight so I eventually feel asleep. The breakfast room as with all london hotels wasnt the largest but you got a full english. The breakfast was great actually. Really excellent especially the sausages.. The orange juice was squash but I am not complaining. All in all, a great place for a single nite to catch the eurostar. I would recommend but carry ear plugs. You cant beat the price for a twin room with breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “friendly,clean,location all 5 star”
Reviews.Author: vodkastr8
Reviews.Content: stay/ 5 nights sightseeing room/ twin en suite small but clean and adequate catering/buffet breakfast full english plus cereal etc staff/could not do enough for you friendly efficent security/24 hour reception no problems location/2 min walk from kings cross station/underground/buses all attractions were just a couple of stops away on tube

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic friendly hotel :-)”
Reviews.Author: Bawdyheid
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Montana Excel were really friendly and helpful and the room was ideal for a short weekend break in London. We'll definitely be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “never again!”
Reviews.Author: SheWray
Reviews.Content: Got to the hotel, very surly receptionist booked us in.Told we were on 2nd floor and there was no lift - we had a large case so I had to ask for it to be kept in storage. Room - well , I am sure a prison cell is better than that, we had asked for a double bed - there were 2 singles. TV - was out of the ark and didnt have a remote, picture was diabolical. ~One of the window handles was missing. Shower - was filthy, maybe just as well there was no hot water. Reading their own website they claim ALL rooms have been refurbished and in pleasing colours - if that is the case I would sack the interior designer, shades of grime do not appeal. We had told the receptionist we would need a taxi early the next morning to take us to St Pancras - she more or less sneered and said surely you can walk!!!!!! (With a large case and a holdall - oh yeah - and my walking stick) We told her we would have to leave before breakfast at 7 - we werent offered the packed meal which they claim they do either. We set the alarm in the room - its the same as the one we have at home - but it didnt go off. I never slept anyway because of all the strange noises at all hours. We went down to reception the next morning at about 6.30 and there was no-one there. Eventually a chap burst through the front door apologising for not being there - he had had to go and get a tin opener - what kind of hotel doenst have one or a spare ? I had booked the hotel online and the site I did it through asked for a review - funnily enough it kept saying there was an error every time I pressed to post! The only good thing about the hotel was that it was near the station

Reviews.Title: “A place for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Anskunen
Reviews.Content: Location was perfect. Staff was nice and friendly. NO bedbugs, so big plus for that. Plenty of tea and coffeebags in the room. Breakfast was ok. They also have adapters for appliances in the reception. My room was in the basement, and therefore a bit cold. The small window (that you could not see throug) was drafty, and located above the bed. So the bed was a cold place to be, but the radiator heated the rest of the room except floors and the shover. Hot water all times. The cleaning was another thing, table surfaces and shover was clean, but carpet was a bit dirty and there were big spiderwebs on the corners of the room. For a short stay it was ok, but i wouldn't stay there for a week.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Acceptable London Hotel At a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: BuryTraveller
Reviews.Content: The Montana Excel is located very close to Kings Cross/St Pancras station(s). Basically cross the road outside Kings Cross and walk about 200 yards up Argyle Street - couldn't ahve been easier. The hotel faces onto a lovely green space (Argyle Square). My room was at the top of the hotel and was a pretty small double, but it perfectly suited my needs of somewhere central, clean and quiet to sleep prior to a conference the next day. The en-suite was also small (loo, sink and shower) but everything worked and was clean. The staff were friendly and helpful. There is free wi-fi - ask at reception for the access code. The decor/fittings/etc were not the newest or best, but everything was very reasonable for the price of the accommodation. I'm not saying that it was cheap or in poor condition, just that you must have a sensible expectation of what you're going to get for your money. It's certainly not Fawlty Towers! (but neither is it the Ritz.). I paid Â£60 for a double en-suite for 1 person for a Thursday night stay. The price included breakfast (which I didn't have so can't comment on, other than that it smelled lovely as I checked out) - which, for London is a great price. This is not a top-class or luxury hotel but it isn't representing itself as such. I would certainly stay here again either for a similar business trip or if looking for an inexpensive base for a weekend in London. My main concern beforehand was the reputation of Kings Cross for being seedy. Clearly however a lot of work has been done in the area and I had no reason to feel uneasy the whole time I was there, including a walk around in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Very Reasonable !”
Reviews.Author: Fashionistaaa007
Reviews.Content: Good value for money. We stayed in a family room, the bathroom was very spacious. We stayed for a long weekend and found it perfectly adequate. Staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was nice. Beds were uncomfortable though, unfortunately, but we weren't staying long enough for that to be an issue. Good location too, very short walk from Kings Cross Station. Generally good enough. Some people have unrealistic expectations - what you pay for is usually what you get, if you're expecting The Ritz then don't !

Reviews.Title: “I would avoid this dangerous fire trap!”
Reviews.Author: scedwar
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Montana in Dec 2008 and was appalled. I'm a Londoner but at the time didn't have my flat in London, was living overseas and was passing through London and needed somewhere for one night in central London. I was ashamed that the hotel was in my home town. The receptionist made Russian intourist hotels look friendly and then, as we walked up to the room the main fire escape (and the only one from our room) was completely blocked by around 15 huge laundry bags. I raised this with the receptionist who seemed unwilling to do anything about it. At first I was told they would be "moved in the morning!". "So what if there was a fire tonight?" "Ugh?". I had to be very persistent to ensure these were actually removed that evening - fortunately I'm an English lawyer so I could at least speak with some authority. Fire regulations in the UK are there to protect hotel users! Otherwise the hotel was mediocre. The room was basic, the hot water wasn't hot and the bed sheets were not exactly the cleanest. Breakfast the next morning was poor. You can get amazing English breakfasts at many cafe's in the Kings Cross area. If you're travelling from overseas to visit Britain this hotel does not show the best of what we can offer. Please avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful, great breakfasts, small rooms, grubby shower.”
Reviews.Author: HumpreyB
Reviews.Content: Excellent location because of its close proximity to St Pancras/ Kings Cross, tube National and International Rail stations. Small room - clean linen, comfortable bed, and we were grateful to be on the ground floor because of our large, unweildy bags. Unfortunately the shower was not clean but diry and mouldy - even though the water pressure was perfectly adequate. Breakfasts were the best part and we ate heartily before our days activities. An excellent English Breakfast - just what I was hoping for, with eggs, bacon, sausages, tomatoes, baked beans, toast, butter, jams and coffee/tea.

Reviews.Title: “Small but catered to baby”
Reviews.Author: BabyOnTheMove
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one afternoon and night at the Montana. We arrived from Heathrow and there was a pack & play set up for our 7 month old. The room was very small, but all we required for our overnight and very early morning departure. We had no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing bad to point ! Good price, nice and comfy !”
Reviews.Author: suteki
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just 50m from the St.Pancras Station (metro and train) The neighborhood was nice and calm Everything smelled clean and good The staff were extremely kind and nice The room was really comfy Everything worked fine The breakfast was good (apart that they don't provide hot milk :) ) No problems or things to point out as bad things!

Reviews.Title: “Fine if you are less demanding”
Reviews.Author: A.Brouwer
Reviews.Content: Because I was travelling by eurostar I needed a hotel near the St.Pancrass station. The Montana Excel had a good price so I decided to stay here. Yes, I have read the comments but gave it a try. The hotel is a short walk from both the St.Pancrass and King's Cross stations. If you arrive by underground be sure to use the euston road (southern side) exit. Head into crestfield street, the hotel is opposite a playing field and park. When inside the hotel you will notice it's small and cramped. The stairs are also small and there is no lift so a big suitcase might not be a good idea. I believe the hotel is good for 1 or 2 nights, not longer. My small room had no toilet, no desk and no chair. The tv is small and old (no remote). The shower is small which might be a problem if you are a big person! Breakfast is OK but the breakfast room is small so come before 8.00 am. Breakfast is served between 7.00 am and 9.00 am. No complaints about hotel staff: they are friendly and helpful. But the location is perfect. There are many restaurants and foodshops nearby. This hotel is defintely not for the much demanding traveller but it was sufficient for me.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value for the money!”
Reviews.Author: RasmusK
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located right next to KingÂ´s Cross tubestation, which has 4 different lines to choose from. Granted itÂ´s a bit far to walk to anywhere touristy, but with the tube so close it does not matter. The breakfast served here is all you can eat of a full english breakfast - not something you normally see at hotels in this pricerange. Will definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Basic cheap King's Cross 1 night stay”
Reviews.Author: Nimsoc
Reviews.Content: Good things: -Price -Location near King's x Bad things: -smell !!!! -Very basic breakfast, only full english and some cereal. Wouldn't even heat up some milk. -room and furniture -LOTS OF NOISE in the morning from the banging doors. If you don't want to get up at 6 AM don't go here. Unless you need a one-night stop for king's x don't go here.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: wearygypsy
Reviews.Content: Exhausted after flying, this was a depressing room to come to. Duct tape covered the tears in the hallway carpet, and the room was spartan. No outlets in the bathroom, and no mirror in the room - made it difficult to blow dry, etc. No towel racks. The window had been bashed in (although outside it was covered with another layer of glass). Reasonably quiet, considering it was just off the lobby. Breakfast was fine - typical English breakfast. Good location near Kings Cross underground, but area was so so.

Reviews.Title: “What a load of rubbish, horrible”
Reviews.Author: stormgazer
Reviews.Content: stayed there on Sunday 26th April 2009 and our room number was G6 if you can call it a room that is, it was a box with two single beds which were the worst bed i've ever slept in, the furniture was disgusting and paint peeling, there was no ensuite you had to use the toilet and shower that everyone else used, there was however a sink in the room but it was awful in there, the bedding was old and smelly and when we left at 4am, there were prostitutes walking up and down the road outside, i would not recommend this hotel to anyone on the plus side, it was really close to St pancras eurostar train station but i'd rather catch a taxi from wales than stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Please don't stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: Yorkshire1987
Reviews.Content: DONâ€™T STAY HERE! My boyfriend and I stayed here at the end of Feb 09 and it is safe to say that we will never ever return! We knew what to expect with budget hotels and the room was fine, as was the location. However, on our second day, after a long day sightseeing my boyfriend went to freshen up and found that someone had defecated in our shower. We had used it in the morning, so we were even more horrified when we realised that our room must have been left open and unattended for this to happen. The staff were extremely unapologetic, and the only offer of compensation we got was a new room, which we thought was a given anyway. As we were in a rush to get to a show, this greatly inconvenienced us. We paid full price for an unsecure room, with a shower that had been used as a toilet, donâ€™t ever stay at his hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Not noisy at all and still so close to Kings Cross!”
Reviews.Author: Entheniel
Reviews.Content: I went here with my mom, we stayed for four nights and will definitively go back if we're going to London in the future. The only not-so-good thing about this hotel is the lack of a little sofa group or something like it for the guests, but if you are as us, it will not really bother you. We were to much outside to notice this little detail too much. Another minus is that the breakfastroom gets crowded if you get to late out of bed in the morning, but that is all negative sides I can find. The breakfast is a rather nice little buffet, and if you need any more of anything at all you can just ask the staff and they will help you get it. The breakfast-room is nice and light, even though it is placed in the basement. We ordered an "en-suite" room or something like it, and probably got a little bigger room that way, we did not pay to much more for it than an ordinary two-bed room, so it might be a nice investment if you don't like the small hotel rooms you mostly get in London. Our windows could open up and the room was clean and nice, and our towels got changed every day. The bathroom was a nice size and also spotless. There was no phone or so in our room, we had an waterwarmer, tea and coffee, sugar and cream and cups, a small, old tv, and a closet, and the table who held the tv also had a little cabinet. I noticed that even though we had no phone in our room, there was an available phone in one of the hallways, and that the note with fire-instructions on our rooms door also told all the important things we needed to know, like check-out time, and that you could borrow an iron and ironing-board if in need, and some other things. They had a luggageroom we had our stuff nicely locked in to we got our room, and the staff was nice and friendly, we also had no problems finding the hotel. All you really need is the address and you will find it if you go from kings cross. You can also find starbucks, a lot of nice sandwich-places and some restaurants not to far from the hotel, so no big problems there. The hotel does as mentioned here already lie in between other buildings around a little nice park, so no noisy highway involved. Our rooms door also had a nice snap-lock which looked rather strong, and our door held out most of the little noise from the hallway outside.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel, room needs improvements”
Reviews.Author: ralfvd
Reviews.Content: This budget hotel is located near a tube. Not the best neighborhood at night. Check-in was fast and friendly. There is no lift in the hotel. Small room, worn-out bed, shower was ok. The toilet, which is situated in the corridor could not be locked. There is only one staircase, so no extra emergency exits available. No Internet facilities, no gym. Breakfast is ok, but only available until 9am, also in weekends. Check-out was again fast. Luggage storage is available, beware though that this storage is accessible for everyone, so it may not be the safest place to your valuable goods. If you don't expect too much and you are on a tight budget, this hotel could be considered.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Good Value for London”
Reviews.Author: ajeep8u_Italy
Reviews.Content: London is well known as the city with the worst value lodging in the world. It also has a reputation for rampant bed bugs (I've been attacked twice, both in hotels over Â£100 per night) and strange plumbing (what's with those separate hot and cold sink faucets - my right hand is freezing while my left is burning) - based on these criteria, the Montana Excel is really quite a good value. The hotel is very well located, only a few hundred feet from the Kings Cross/St Pancras Tube station. It's on a quiet street with Argyle Square (a little park) in front. Be aware that Google maps might send you to 16-18 Argyle Street - which is the wrong address a couple streets west. Be sure to enter "18 Argyle Square, WC1H" when searching google. I stayed on an overnight layover and airport transfer on December 23rd. The Hotel was almost empty and the entire city was very quiet. The receptionist was very polite and she upgraded me to a double room, from my single room reservation, without any second thought. It's worth noting that this location is very convenient for taking the Tube to Heathrow and coming from Stansted. The room itself (Room G5) was nothing to get excited over. I was on the ground floor, just across the hall from the door leading to reception. The room had a shower and a sink but no toilet. The toilets were just outside the room, only 12 feet down the hall. While I was there I saw no other guests. The toilets smelled and looked clean. The room had good linens and decent pillows and towels. Many low-end hotels wash their bath towels with their kitchen towels, transferring the kitchen grease smell to everything. The Montana Excel's bath towels had only a faint smell of kitchen grease, meaning they likely only partially subscribed to this philosophy. The beds were comfortable, the window opened to a small center atrium, which allowed in some nice, fresh air. The room had no heating controls, the heat radiated from the walls surrounding the sink. This was effective at heating but really was too much without keeping the window open for balance. The television was small but worked fine. There was a small fan in the room that didn't work. Nearly every plastic thing in the room, like the tv remote control was sticky or greasy and contained who knows how many microscopic nasties. The shower opened directly into the room with a carpeted floor. If you opened the shower door while the water was running, it splashed all over the carpet. Overall the room was pretty clean but there wasn't anything in there that was purchased this century, save for the linens. In conclusion, the Montana Excel offers a very good value and clean room for those who appreciate a well-located, budget hotel. It's very possible to pay twice the amount for hotels less clean and in worse locations in London.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, good location”
Reviews.Author: whitbyabi
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a single room at the hotel in November 2008 for 1 night. I found the location great as it is directly opposite Kings Cross station. The staff were really friendly, the room clean with a kettle & TV and the breakfast was lovely; buffet style with cereal and cooked breakfast, tea & coffee. My only bad comment was that the water in the shower could have done with being hotter, apart from that no problems. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent little place”
Reviews.Author: epcnd
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms at the Montana Excel on the 28th of Nov, one single and one triple. Both were clean and neat, but the shower in the single was tiny, if you weigh over 220 pounds you will not be comfortable using it. This hotel is a good value in a great location. If you are staying here try to get a room 'with en-suite toilet and shower.' which will give you a larger bathroom. Wouldn't mind staying here a second time.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic - good location for Eurostar”
Reviews.Author: Scarlett-Leeds
Reviews.Content: This hotel is extremely basic, but is ideal for the Eurostar, if your on the first one in the morning and just wanting somewhere to crash for a few hours. At Â£50 in London, you can't expect much, and there is not much offered. The room was very small, and had a shower cubicle next to the bed. The toilet was on the floor below, Clean room, but walls are very thin. 2 mins from the train station.

Reviews.Title: “terrible in the basement”
Reviews.Author: chardonnay60
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in Montana Excel. 2 adults and 2 children. (10,12). The room was in the basement. During the day was it warm in London. The room was very hot (no airconditioning), and the air in the room was stuffy. The bathroom was not clean. When I told the lady in the reception that I was very disappointed about the room she said that I was wrong and that it was a nice room (!!!). After 2 nights we could move to another room. This room was better. The room in the basement is a very bad room, and I want with this review to warn people not to except rooms in the basement from Montana Excel.

Reviews.Title: “Not fantastic but I'd recommend”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Gem
Reviews.Content: This isn't the nicest place I've ever stayed but overall I'd recommend it. We actually stayed at the Montana and not the Montana Excel but they're owned by the same people (and within a few doors of each other). It's expensive (we paid Â£60 per room per night for a double) but everywhere in London is expensive. It comparison to elsewhere in London I'd say it was good value for money. The room was clean (but small), sheets were clean, tea and coffee facilities were provided in the room and the tv worked. The shower was hot (also small). The best thing about the hotel was the bed was comfortable (we were doing a lot of sightseeing and exhausted by the end of the day) and the breakfast was very nice - lots of choice of cereals and hot food, hot drinks and juices and it was served buffet style so you could fill up for the day. Location is excellent - a couple of minutes walk from Kings Cross station and very easy to find. On the morning we were packing up to leave it was raining very heavily and water started streaming down the curtains. I'm not sure if this was a leak or the ceiling was damaged, if it was a permanent problem or a one off. We mentioned it to the staff when we were checking out but as we were leaving it didn't really concern us and we didn't find out the cause. The only thing I had a problem with and would warn other travellers of is that the hotel asks you to leave your key at reception (manned 24 hours) whenever you're out. I know this is not unheard of but it's one of my pet peeves. Overall the Montana is a great base for seeing London. Its basic but has all the essentials.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for touring London!!!”
Reviews.Author: KCraigs
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 days, and the Montana Excel was perfect! The staff was very friendly and extremely helpful, and the Kings Cross/St. Pancras station is a 2 minute walk from the hotel. The rooms are small but clean, and the breakfast is all-you-can-eat and very good. The street is quiet, and there are several good restaurants and pubs within walking distance. For $100 a night, you can't go wrong staying here - especially if you plan to spend your days checking out the sights!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean rooms, good price”
Reviews.Author: adderi
Reviews.Content: Hotel Montana was absolutely fantastic hotel. We had never been in London before and the hotel was really easy find from Kings Cross/St Pancrass station. Easy acces to all over the city with underground. We got our room downstairs just by the breakfastroom. Room was normal British standard. Bed was clean and bathroom looked somewhat renovated. Water did not run that well in the shower, but who cares as long as it is warm :-) There was also a small TV with some channels. Breakfast was included but it had quite a weird opening hours - just untill 9am. If you're looking for an ok hotell with good location, good price and nice staff this hotel is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: martaEasternEurope
Reviews.Content: There were four of us sharing one room for nine nights early february 2008 - the fact that we didn't end up over the edge speaks for itself. The room was large enough for all of us and our luggage (some decent hangers wouldn't hurt but that's such a minor complaint that it hardly seems worthy to mention). As long as we're talking minor improvements - a shelf above the batroom sink and maybe an adjustable shower (i mean the height, not the water temperature which we had no problem with during our 10-days stay) would be nice cheap adjustments they could make. As for cleanliness - well, I guess it depends on your standards; carpet was vacuumed and towels changed every day, beddings every other day or so; however i couldn't get my eyes off the thick layer of dust on the ceiling light in the room or on the fan in the batroom (i ended up cleaning the latter myself, it drove me crazy). I guess they do their best during high season and details like these get left out most of the times. The room didn't have double glazed windows and at first we thought heating was going to be problematic but as soon as we expressed our concerns - actually they were complaints cause the room was too cold for us - they turned on a second radiator and we were great. Breakfast was fine, we had it for 9 days so it's hard to be extatic about it but we liked it and it kept us going for many hours. Had it been just the hotel room I was reviewing I would have rated it 3 Neutral / Average, but the whole package deserves more: the staff was accomodating, the location is excellent as a base for exploring the whole city be it by tube, bus or by foot for certain areas and the price we paid was unbeatable (90 pounds/night, quadruple ensuite, breakfast included).

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Eloton
Reviews.Content: Well the room obviously hadn't even seen a vacuumer for a long time. Even though I'm not allergic to dust, it was not easy to breathe in the room. And what seems to be typical for english houses, there was a 2 cm hole between the windows, so cold air was coming to the room all the time. If you need a quick shower, don't try to have one at the hotel. It takes about 5 minutes for a person to get wet because there isn't actually much water coming down from the shower. I also had some problems with the shower's door. While I was trying to wash shampoo off from my hair with the little water I was getting, the door got stuck and I couldn't open it from the inside. Luckily I was travelling with my boyfriend who came to open it. The room's door was quite thin and didn't seem that secure and it was banging when other people were closing their rooms' doors. Breakfast was good compared to breakfasts that I've had in similiar hotels. Staff was friendly, location is great. The hotel is good quality for the price. If you only need a place to sleep in and you're not too bothered about the dust in the room, I recommend Montana Excel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: GRAHAME2001
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in an excellent position for the stations. Staff were friendly and accomodating. Rooms are very small and would not suggest a long stay here.. The price is excellent for what you get (we paid Â£65 p/n for a twin room 06/12/07 ). beds are just ok enabling a good nights sleep. Shower and toilet are ok well much better than a piblic loo. Great for walking into centre and the Tube is very close. The cleanliness of the room is poor but the bedding and bed were fine. Lots of storage space for clothes,

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great price”
Reviews.Author: sofe1978
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a cheap basic hotel for a 2 night stay in London and this was perfect. We had a twin room with onsuite. It was really basic with 2 small beds but as it was only somewhere to sleep this was perfect and the price was great.. and included breakfast too! Like others have said the stairs are steep so I wouldn't want to do it with a big suitcase but it wasn't too much of a chore. Location is fantastic, literally opposite Kings Cross station. If you want a cheap central hotel then I would definatly recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: “cheap and cheerful, central and clean”
Reviews.Author: donaldasher
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Montana Excel on 19-21 September 2007. Staff were friendly, room was spotless, breakfast was okay, but trying to get luggage up three flights of narrow and steep stairs was exhausting. Try and get a room on the lower floors. It is a small hotel, with even smaller rooms, but for â‚¤60 a night for a double, including breakfast in central London, you can't go wrong. Five minutes walk from Kings Cross/ St Pancras and there are plenty of eating choices in the vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Montana & Montana Excel - Lot's of stays”
Reviews.Author: BigAudio
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Montana & Montana Excel a number of times since January 2003, and it's always been "pretty OK". In all honesty, the room prices have always been the main consideration - it's very much a cheap & cheerful place, basic but adequate facilities, etc, etc. I must agree with another reviewer about the plastic/styrofoam cups in the rooms for making yourself a hot drink - that's always a bug-bear considering how cheap mugs are. I tend to take a beaker in my rucksack whenever I stay there now!! The breakfast buffet is always good and plentiful, but having only ever travelled with at least one other person, I've never had the problem of not getting a table in the breakfast room in the basement. I have seen other people being somewhat ignorant and hogging full tables and not being willing to move, which is a bit of a sad indictment on the English Traveller. If you want somewhere cheap, conveniently located, clean and compact in London, you can't go far wrong with the Montana & Montana Excel - but always remember you get what you pay for...

Reviews.Title: “BASIC, SMALL AND CLEAN HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: chickydee
Reviews.Content: Montana hotel was fine, we paid Â£28 pppn for room with shower and breakfast. Rooms are very small, but clean and comfortable. Tea and coffee is supplied in abundance in the room. Breakfast was very good, and you could eat as much as you like, toast, bacon, poached eggs, beans, tomatoes cereals, juice, tea and coffee. I thought the hotel was great value for money, and as we were sightseeing, we only spent limited time in the room anyway. Minuses for this place would be the shared toilet and the fact that some of the rooms were difficult to reach when carrying luggage up the narrow stairs, but overall it was fine. The staff were very friendly and we had a good laugh with Natalia the receptionist. Very central location, on top of the northern line so everything was in easy reach, also loads of shops and takeaways nearby. Can recommend the food at the chop house. Expect to get what you pay for with this one, no frills, but more money in your pocket for the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Came so close to recommending this...”
Reviews.Author: blackdahlia
Reviews.Content: Well, my stay began so well! Superb location, literally minutes from King's Cross, which was the reason I picked it - I went to a concert in London on Sunday night and had to get an early train to visit family the following day. Room was small but perfectly adequate for my needs - one small niggle there, though, namely polystyrene cups for the tea and coffee...proper cups are cheap enough at any pound shop! Comfortable bed, plenty of hot water in the shower...and then the morning rolled around - which was when I discovered that although the buffet breakfast looked absolutely delicious, the Montana is yet another hotel that expects its guests to eat at communal tables. There were only a few tables available, and the occupants had positioned themselves in such a way that they were clearly unwilling to share them - and since I didn't have time to wait indefinitely, the McDonalds round the corner had to suffice. Hotels need to be aware that although Europeans may not mind this practice, Brits find it slightly uncomfortable - especially women travelling alone - and as a result, despite the location and cheap rate, I won't be staying here again or recommending it. Sorry!

Reviews.Title: “excellent for small budget”
Reviews.Author: aetg
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one the less expensive in London. We paid 50 pounds per night for a twin room with a shower. Toilets are shared but very clean. The room is tiny but clean. The english breakfast is also included in the price. You have eggs, sausages, hams, beans and also bread and jam. This is a buffet so you can eat as you want. The staff is nice. You have a 2 minutes walk to go to King's Cross where you have trains, subways and buses. So it is really easy to go in each part of London. The only badpoint is about the noise. If you have noisy people in the next room you will hear them. Be careful if you pay by card because they add 5%. In conclusion, if you are looking for a good hotel at a small rate in the center of London don't hesitate and go to Montana Excel.

Reviews.Title: “Good surprise!”
Reviews.Author: kapwinggreg
Reviews.Content: We expected something worse! Actually, the hotel is clean, the room was comfortable and the bathroom was ok. Honestly there is a (very) decent minimum: nothing is amazing but nothing is disappointing either. If you don't plan to spend your days in your room, then we recommend it! Ps : the breakfast tasted like an British breakfast...

Reviews.Title: “Good Value - Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: marcuschap72
Reviews.Content: Firstly i have to say that the staff we encountered on our short (1 night stay) were fantastic. The female receptionist was very friendly and even complimented us all on our outfits Saturday night! The night receptionist was also very helpful, he took my friend down to the kitchen and let her warm her take-away in the microwave in the early hours of Sun morning. We had a quad room and it was a very good size, there were a few small problems but considering we'd paid just Â£21 each i didn't complain. The room was bright and generally clean but the carpet looked like it desperately needed a vaccum and the hangers in the open wardrobe were very dusty. The bathroom was bright and clean but unfortuantely their wasn't enough hot water so i was the unlucky one that got a cold shower! The bed linen and towels were clean so it was comfortable enough for our needs. Breakfast finished at 9am so we decided to opt out in favour of a lie in. So i can't comment on the food but my friend did say that the kitchen and dining room were spotless. This isn't the best hotel in London but it's friendly and good value for money, i'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: Knolly
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Montana Excel for 4 nights, early in May 2006. I would happily recommend as being very good value for money, in London. The staff were friendly and efficient. The breakfast was an added bonus - I am a cholesterol junkie. The room was clean. The bed was small but adequate. The room overlooked a tranquil square. TV, radio, en suite shower and tea/coffee making facilities were all part of the deal. It is well situated - being just up the road from Kings Cross Station. I was very happy and accepted the hotel for what it was - remarkably good value in London. Howard Neill Cape Town, South Africa

Reviews.Title: “Just OK!”
Reviews.Author: SCFP
Reviews.Content: After checking out this B&B through various websites and most importantly the reviews on Trip Advisor, we decided to go for Montana Excel considering it's location and price. The people at the reception desk (mostly Russians) were neither friendly nor polite or keen and excited to see guests coming into the hotel. Room was small, which was expected, but clean. Water takes about 5 minutes to get hot in the shower and could be a challenge during winter! Bed was really small, too small for Caucasions I would say but thank god my husband and I are not too big in size! You could feel the springs on the mattress but luckily for our weight, it did not reach the level of which they pierce through the mattress! One thing I have to comment is, the breakfast. English breakfast served hot and fresh every morning by the same Russian woman who has to cook breakfast, clean up the dishes and clean the rooms. No wonder she pulls a long face every morning!! Overall, it was just OK for 55 pounds/night.

Reviews.Title: “Not awful but not great”
Reviews.Author: not-my-real-name-007
Reviews.Content: I was expecting a small room so I wasn't overly surprised by the tinyness of the room or compactness of the shower. Small but functional and clean. The lady on reception was friendly. So far so good..... Realised too late at night the TV wouldn't work as it's remote had no batteries, in the morning I woke with burning eyes from the cigarette smoke that was seeping under my door - I had specifically asked them for non-smoking for health reasons. The shower gave no hot water. The curtain didn't cover the whole window so had to move it to the bit you were in to avoid providing a display for opposite windows! Went down for breakfast - food was fine, and a buffet so you could eat as much as you like. Previous reviewers have said about greasy food - well, that is what an English breakfast is! Like it or lump it. There was the traditional English fry up plus cereal, toast, fruit juice and tea/coffee. The problem with breakfast though was the moody woman serving in there - she gave off such a horrid atmosphere. Despite all that - it's cheap for central London and was clean and I felt safe there as a lone female...... I have stayed in some real rat holes in London in the past so whilst Montana was not great it was certainly not awful and I wouldn't say avoid. I'd probably go back if I was needing a cheap room in London unless I could find somewhere that was completely non-smoking.

Reviews.Title: “Suprisingly nice B & B on a quiet street”
Reviews.Author: Abal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Montana Excel for 6 nights. It was very nice and we wouldn't hesitate to stay there again. It is far enough away from Euston Road (which is extremely busy) to be quiet. The whole place is spotlessly clean, and tho some of the carpet is kind of old, there's a fresh coat of paint, so it's not run down. We had an overhead light that burnt out - asked them to fix it, which they did. The room was big enough to move around in - small by U.S standards, but this is London! The beds reasonably comfortable, and there are wardrobes you can put your things in. The windows open. The shower was too small, the shower curtain stuck to one side of you much of the time, but that was the only bad thing we encountered. We weren't too fond of the English breakfast, but it was good quality and since it was buffet style, we were able to choose what we wanted to eat. The breakfast room is big enough so that we always found a place to sit. The staff was nice and they have a locked room you can keep your suitcases in for a few hours after checking out.

Reviews.Title: “I'll come back next time”
Reviews.Author: Crow76
Reviews.Content: We got a room for two persons with a clean bathroom for 110 pounds for two nights. The location was great (5 min. walk to King's Cross station) and the staff was nice. The breakfast was ok, not much to choose from (toast, eggs, bacon, sausages, white beans in tomato-sauce, marmelade, coffee, tea and orange juice) but for just two mornings it was fine. If I come back to London I'll take the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Montana Excel is OK”
Reviews.Author: SÃƒÂ©bastien
Reviews.Content: This hotel is cheap for London and that's in my view the main advantage: you can spend your money elsewhere. The room was quite clean (I found a hair in the bed) but had some minor flaws. We shared a bathroom which door could not be closed... and of course there was a person insidewhen I first wanted to come in! To sum up: the room and facilities were OK. No decoration, no style, just for sleeping. The shower was very small. We stayed in the 4th floor which was very quiet. We slept very well. The breakfast was below average, not very tasteful. And the staff was OK. Finally, this hotel is located quite far away from the city center. So you must take the bus or the tube.
